Mr Julius, is there any other housekeeping we need to do before we close the pre-trial hearing?
73 Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 52.
A small room. Almost informal, just a single JUDGE, JOHN TRENCH, 60s. IRVING, now 61, at one table, JULIUS at anot in suit and tie, with LIBSON behind him.
Just one question, my Lord.
What is it?
On our side, we're beginning to feel that for the layman this particular subject may represent an impossible challenge.
I see. You’re asking to dispense with a jury?
We are, my Lord.
Have you asked Mr Irving his views? Mr Irving? IRVING stirs, uncertain. But JULIUS modestly interrupts.
Perhaps, before Mr Irving speaks?
Go ahead.

We all know: Mr Irving has devoted his life to the study of the Third Reich. I admit myself to having sometimes struggled with the demands of the material. I wonder if Mr Irving really believes that it’s fair to ask the regular Joe or Joan who walks in from the street to grasp in a mere few weeks what he himself has taken a life-time to master. IRVING is looking at him. Which way will be jump? Then:
I agree. The issues before the court are sufficiently complex to require the attention of a learned judge, and too complex to confront a jury with.  74 Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015
Are you sure, Mr Irving?
Quite sure. JULIUS looks, his bluff perfect.
A trial by judge alone it is then.

head_text.subj: INT. DEBORAH'S ROOM. ATHENAEUM HOTEL. DAY

text: 74 DEBORAH is unpacking - unfamiliar adaptor plugs, guide bo She's thought of everything. Then a framed photo of herse with The Mutt goes in pride of place. DAVID IRVING is on doing a respectful studio interview.
Naturally, I’m delighted this case is finally coming to court.
You're representing yourself?

I have the advantage that although I don’t know the law, I do know the topic. It would cost me half a million pounds to hire professional representation. And unlike Miss Lipstadt, I don’t have access to a network with that kind of money.
Oh this is about money, is it? DEBORAH is shaking her head. A knock at the door.
Come in. A BELL-BOY appears with a huge bunch of white lilies.
The manager wants you to have these. He’s wishing you luck.
Thank you. Thank you very much. I’m just asking, but in your country are white lilies lucky?
I think so, yes.  75 76 77 Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 54.
Just how in the States you usually see them on a grave.

DEBORAH is turning her room into an operations centre: unpacking books, videotapes, files onto the desk. From th Sunday Times, she cuts out a photo of IRVING: “Irving Predicts Complete Victory”. She tapes it to the side of h computer screen. On the TV, Victoria Wood in Dinner Ladie DEBORAH looks bewildered at this most English of comedies

The television in IRVING'S room is also playing Dinner Ladies. IRVING looks at it a moment, enjoying the humour. Then turns back to his desk to carry on his preparation. his computer a screen-grab of DEBORAH being humiliated at DeKalb. He works on.
NETWORK REPORTERS are speaking straight to camera, from t middle of a pavement scrum - photographers, reporters.
This morning will see the beginning of an extraordinary case in which a well-known historian and an obscure American academic will do battle to decide whether the Holocaust took place...
Sources are saying that a whole network of supporters in the United States, including the film director Stephen Spielberg, are paying for Miss Lipstadt’s defence...
... Mr Irving is rumoured to have a list of over 4,000 contributors. They include a former U-boat captain who lives in Hawaii...

It’s expected that this trial will be a long one, both sides digging in for a protracted fight... CAPTION: JANUARY 11th, 2000  78 Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 55. On the opposite pavement, DEBORAH, dressed in coat and sc is amazed to see the scrum. Resolutely she starts crossin the road. The press has recognized her and is calling out ‘Deborah, Deborah’ and ‘Miss Lipstadt.’ She takes out a p of paper and turns to read from it. As she does, JULIUS a LAURA appear from nowhere like policemen.
Good morning, Deborah. DEBORAH turns in surprise. JULIUS is wearing a black robe
We wanted to make sure you didn’t go in alone.
That’s sweet of you.
It’s not sweet at all. We wanted to make sure you didn’t speak.

It’s just a short statement. Look, there’s Julie McCarthy, NPR... But he has already put his arm round her and LAURA has ta the other, manoeuvring her into the building. A man appea in front of DEBORAH’s face.

Lying Jewish bitch! But JULIUS has her quickly out of the way. As the MAN is hustled away by POLICE, he is heard shouting “Don’t think there’s anywhere to hide. We’re going to finish what Hitl started.”

location: CLOISTERS AND INTERIOR. LAW COURTS. DAY 78

text: Inside they let go, and suddenly DEBORAH is all alone, looking at the amazing Gothic scale and splendour of the building. She’s awed, but her contemplation of it is disturbed by the arrival at the entrance of IRVING outsid lit by camera lights, the press surrounding him.

Good morning, everyone. I’m looking forward to this, if I may say a few words... She watches furious as the press write down everything he says. She catches up with JULIUS, with NIK and THOMAS carrying boxes of documents towards the court.
+ eH  79 80 Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 56.
Did you see him? He’1l be all over the front pages...
Deborah, there’s only one person who matters and that’s the judge. If you don’t speak in court and you do speak in the press, the judge is going to be furious. And rightly.
Yeah, well, we both know the answer to that. DEBORAH looks at JULIUS bitterly.
And another thing. You jog the same way every day. Don’t.
What are you saying?
I’m not saying anything. I’m just saying, vary your route. DEBORAH looks back outside. The angry MAN is still there.

An obvious contrast: DEBORAH waiting on the left-hand sid the court which is full - DEBORAH now smiles at FORBES-WA who smiles back. RAMPTON is in wig and silk robe, alongsi JULIUS, LIBSON, HELENA, HEATHER and the team of researche led by LAURA. Stack upon stack of boxes and bundles of evidence. DEBORAH turns and looks up to the gallery. Some obvious Irving supporters - skinheads in T-shirts and tat and some less obvious - Aryan women and middle-aged men. she looks to the deserted opposite side as IRVING comes i papers under his arm, bare space all around. He puts his papers down in silence. JULIUS smiles.

David and Goliath. As advertised. IRVING suddenly turns and looks straight at DEBORAH. OK Corral - their look held. INT. JUDGE’S CHAMBERS. DAY 80 CHARLES GRAY, a suave, upper-class Englishman, 50s, in wi and gown is reading alone. The CLERK knocks on the door.  81 82 Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 57.
Sir, they’re ready.

Thank you. GRAY closes the book. It’s HITLER’S WAR by David Irving, covered in post-its and handwritten notes. GRAY finishes cup of tea then puts it down on a desk covered with evide submissions, video-tapes and tottering mountains of books gets up, nods at the CLERK and leaves the room.
GRAY sweeps along the corridor and into the court.
Court rise. Everyone stands. GRAY takes his place. The whole court bo JULIUS whispers to DEBORAH.
Bow.
I’m American. Everything else but no bowing.

Later. The court is packed except for the solitary area around IRVING. He is on his feet and addressing the judge eloquent, commanding, his hands mostly behind his back. DEBORAH is watching closely, trying to get his measure.

My Lord, I intend to show that far from being a Holocaust denier, I have repeatedly drawn attention to major aspects of the Holocaust. These defendants have done very real damage to my professional existence. By virtue of the activities of Miss Lipstadt and those who funded her and guided her hand, since 1996 I have seen one fearful publisher after another falling away from me and turning their backs on me when I approach. My Lord, if we were to seek a title for this libel action, I would venture to suggest “Pictures at an Execution” - my execution.  83 Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 58. RAMPTON, a compulsive cartoonist, is drawing IRVING in th side of a document. DEBORAH, looking round, sees an OLDER WOMAN, VERA REICH, small, upright, 70s, Polish, watching the public gallery.

These defendants did not act alone. They were part of an organized international endeavour to discredit me. The word ‘denier’ is particularly evil. The phrase is a poison to which there is virtually no antidote, less lethal than a hypodermic with nerve gas jabbed in the neck, but deadly all the same. For the chosen victim it is like being called a wife beater or a paedophile. It is enough for the label to be attached for the attachee to find himself designated as a pariah, an outcast from normal society. It is a verbal Yellow Star. IRVING has turned to look at DEBORAH, putting the accusat to her. DEBORAH stares back. RAMPTON’s cartoon shows IRVI hanging from a gallows, the noose captioned ‘Facts’. Underneath he has put the title “Pictures at an Execution
Recess. Everyone is pouring out of the court into the vau hall. DEBORAH is with LAURA, JULIUS and LIBSON.
So, what you did think of him?
Irving? I thought he was oddly impressive.
Impressive? JULIUS smiles, patronising.
The only thing that confused me.. It was like Irving already knew all our questions and points.
Yes of course. We sent them to him.  84 Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 59.
You sent all our questions? In advance? I don’t get it. Isn’t that revealing our strategy?
Deborah, we have no strategy. We plan to box him in with the truth.
DEBORAH watches IRVING closely as RAMPTON rises to his fe at all times addressing GRAY, never once looking at IRVIN

My Lord, Mr Irving calls himself a historian. The truth, however, is that he is not a historian at all, but a falsifier of history. To put it bluntly, he is a liar. DEBORAH looks sharply across at RAMPTON, realising he is using her words. RAMPTON has two books in front of him, separate editions of HITLER'S WAR. He holds up the first then the second. RAMPTON (CONT’D) Between the publication of the first edition of Hitler’s War in 1977, and its second edition in 1991, Mr Irving’s views about the Holocaust underwent a sea-change. In 1977, he accepted it as a historical truth in all its essentials - systematic mass murder of the Jews in purpose-built extermination factories. But in the 1991 edition, all trace of the Holocaust in this sense has disappeared. What are the reasons for this astounding volte-face? The principal reason can be expressed in one word: Leuchter.
The man with the dirty underwear. DEBORAH is so rapt she has spoken to herself. LIBSON shoo glance to JULIUS behind, who has also heard her.
According to Mr Irving, the Leuchter report is “the biggest calibre shell that has yet hit the battleship Auschwitz”. (MORE )
85 Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 60.

Unfortunately for Mr Irving, the Leuchter report is bunk and he knows it. So why then did Mr Irving embrace the Leuchter report with such enthusiasm? Why did he choose to publish it himself and even to write an introduction? The answer must be that he wanted it to be true. After all if the Holocaust never happened, then Hitler cannot have ordered it or known about it.
And that's the point. This time JULIUS puts a finger to his mouth to bid silenc RAMPTON picks up another piece of paper and reads from it

In September 1991 Mr Irving spoke to an audience in Calgary, Alberta. This is what he said: “I don’t see any reason to be tasteful about Auschwitz. It’s baloney. It’s a legend. Oh you think that’s tasteless? How about this? There are so many Auschwitz survivors going round, in fact their number increases as the years go past, that I’m going to form an association of Auschwitz Survivors, Survivors of the Holocaust and Other Liars called A-S-S-H-O-L-S, pronounced no doubt ‘asshols’...” RAMPTON puts down the paper. The court is silenced. Nobod moves. IRVING looks away, uninterested. RAMPTON (CONT’D) My Lord, this is obviously an important case. For if it be true that Mr Irving has devoted his energy to the deliberate falsification of this tragic episode in history, then by exposing that dangerous fraud in this court, the defendants may properly be applauded for having performed a significant public service, not just in this country but wherever in the world anti- Semitism and bigotry is waiting to be fed.
A buzz as everyone flows out into the echoing space.  Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 61.
Wow! I thought we were pretty effective.
Really?
That was a pretty good start.
I’m glad you’re happy.
I saw his face. When we called him a liar. I don’t think he’s used to hearing things like that. It was exciting. VERA has put herself in DEBORAH'S way.
Excuse me. Miss Lipstadt?
Yes?
May I speak to you?
You go ahead, I’1l1 catch up. DEBORAH has said this to JULIUS who hesitates, then goes
I want you to come and meet some of my friends. Friends with something in common. VERA rolls up her sleeve. A tattooed number. DEBORAH star

We want to know: How can you let this happen? We don’t understand. How can it be happening? This is what you call a strategy? None of us have been called. We have to be heard. The voice of suffering has to be heard. A trial of the Holocaust and no witnesses? How can that be right? DEBORAH looks, her own doubts confirmed.
There’s a whole group of us. Deborah, we have to testify. (MORE )
86 87 Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 62.
We have to. On behalf of the others. For the dead. DEBORAH nods slightly. They are in a quiet corner. She reaches out and touches VERA’S arm.
I make you a promise. The voice of suffering will be heard. It will. I promise you that.
DEBORAH comes out into the roar of traffic. The others ha gone. She steps out and nearly gets run over by a bus, forgetting they drive on the left. A passerby calls out “Watch out!” A close thing.
DEBORAH runs up the stairs and into chambers. It looks li party. LAURA, NIK, THOMAS, HEATHER etc. RAMPTON is openin filing cabinet and getting out a bottle of red wine.
I see this could well become a ritual. A welcome ritual, don't misunderstand. Deborah?
No, thank you.

A well-known Attorney General taught me very early on, one’s always a more effective advocate after a few glasses of claret. And some sandwiches. With a flourish, he opens a dusty cupboard and inside the are plates of cut sandwiches. Everyone laughs and piles i DEBORAH moves across to JULIUS in the corner.
I need to talk to you. It’s urgent. I’ve just spoken with a survivor.
Yes. Well that’s likely. I’ve seen several in the court. Someone hands JULIUS a glass of wine.
Deborah, we’re not going to discuss this again.  Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 63.
Why not?
I’ve explained to you.
I don’t think so.

Whatever you say, the survivors are not on trial. That’s how it is. They confuse the issue. Keep them out of it. JULIUS has raised his voice. RAMPTON is alert to every wo but pretending not to listen.
You can look them in the face, can you, you can look survivors in the face and tell them they have no right to testify? They were there! They have the authority.

Deborah, these people came out of hell. I understand that. After all these years, they still haven't processed the experience. I know that too. But a trial, I’m afraid, isn’t therapy. Still less is it vindication. It isn’t our job to give emotional satisfaction to a whole lot of people who can never forget what happened to them.

You think they want to testify for themselves? They don’t give a damn about themselves. It’s the others. It’s their families. It’s their friends. If you were in their shoes, what would you feel? JULIUS just looks, not answering.
Anthony, I promised them they would be heard. I made a promise.
Well then you’d better go back out and break your promise. DEBORAH looks straight at him, then leaves.  Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 64.

DEBORAH is sitting on the wall opposite, watching as the happy little team comes chattering out of RAMPTON’S chamb JULIUS, HEATHER, NIK, TOMAS, LAURA. She looks grim, alone They pass into the distance, chattering. But before they disappear, RAMPTON turns back, unseen, and looks at DEBOR 89 90 91 92 INT.

89 DEBORAH, with boxes of Chinese takeout half-eaten, is watching one of her videos: scratchy film from 1962 of an MAN, HANS STARK, being interviewed. He speaks German, overlaid with an English interpreter.

One day I was ordered to pour Zyklon B into the room because only one medical orderly had shown up. The Zyklon B was in granular form, so it trickled down over people as it poured in. Then they started to cry out terribly because they knew what was happening to them. After a few minutes, there was silence. DEBORAH stares. EXT.

90 In her head DEBORAH sees a flash of what STARK is describ a slit of bright daylight as the hatch is opened, gas mas blue pellets pouring down touching bare flesh, a hatch slammed shut. Screams and cries.
DEBORAH closes her eyes.
LIBBY is house-sitting. She is on the deck, legs in front her, in the dark. The Mutt is beside her.
What’s wrong? You don’t sound happy. What’s happening?
How’s The Mutt?  93 94 Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 65.
The Mutt’s lonely. He’s putting on a show but he’s not fooling anybody. You?
DEBORAH is sitting on the side of the bed. Her room is an unvisited tip. She says nothing to LIBBY’S question.
I‘1l1 tell you what’s happening. Today one of the lawyers, the creepy one, told me if I’d promised anything to the survivors, I’d have to break my promise.
He said that?

Libby, I arrived in London, I thought ‘These men know best, it’s their country, it’s their system.’ I’m with a lot of people who understand the facts. They know all the facts. But God knows where they keep their hearts.

ROBERT JAN is in the witness box. He has toned down the colour of his hair and he has a perfect three-piece suit. Arranged on easels are large colour photographs of Birken and Auschwitz. Beside them are black and white drawings o the gas chamber interior. IRVING is examining him.
May I first of all welcome you to our country and say what a great pleasure I had in reading your book on Auschwitz. You were deeply moved to visit the actual location?
More than moved. I was frightened. It's an awesome responsibility. DEBORAH looks to the gallery. VERA’S look back is unwaver
Professor van Pelt, would you agree it is the duty of historians to remain completely unemotional?  Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 66.
One’s duty is to be unemotional, to be objective, but one's duty I think is to remain human in the exercise. IRVING nods, as if this is just something JAN has to say.

The site of Auschwitz has not changed very much since the end of World War 2, apart from the barracks being torn down and re- cycled. Can you explain to the court, please, why it is that in the very earliest references to Auschwitz published by the Russians after the capture of the camp in January 1945, there is no reference whatsoever to the discovery of gas chambers?
I would need to see the documents you refer to.
That’s fair, I think. IRVING smiles tolerantly at the judge’s interruption.
It is fair, my Lord. Your report quotes extensively from first-hand testimony from a man called Tauber.
Yes. Tauber was a Sonderkommando in Crematorium Number 2. He helped with the prisoners, he was in charge of roll call.
In charge of roll call, yes.
He was interrogated at the end of May 1945.
And, in his document, what does Tauber tell us about the liquidation procedure?

The simulation, please.  Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 ROBERT JAN looks to the judge, who nods permission. A computer simulation of the crematorium is now displayed. camera moves through the concrete-lined rooms. DEBORAH lo up to VERA, who is turned away, unable to watch.

What he describes is the underground arrangement of the crematorium. The entrance was through an undressing room. The prisoners went into a corridor, then through a door on the right into the gas chamber. The door was closed hermetically by means of iron bars which were screwed tight. The roof of the gas chamber was supported by concrete columns and wire-mesh pillars.
Professor? ROBERT JAN pauses the simulation. IRVING gestures towards of the photographs, an aerial view of the collapsed roof.
In your simulation that is the roof we can see on this big photograph here?
Yes.
It is that self-same roof? ROBERT JAN points to his line drawings.
Yes. Tauber says the sides of these pillars which went up through the roof were of heavy wire mesh, like this. IRVING frowns as if not understanding.
What does it mean when it says “the pillars went up through the roof”. Went up to the roof, presumably?
Yes, but they popped out above the roof.
The pillars popped out?  Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 68.
The pillars went through a hole in the roof and the earth which was assembled on top of the roof, and then there was a little kind of chimney on top of that.
What was the purpose of that, architecturally speaking?
Because these were hollow pillars and these were the pillars where the crystals of Zyklon B were inserted into the gas chamber. IRVING gestures to the drawings.
My Lord, you can see the lay out. You can see the pillars with the wire mesh columns next to them. DEBORAH is worried. RAMPTON looks up, also concerned.
You have drawn in those wire mesh columns have you not? In the sketches and on the computer?
One of my students drew them, yes.
Yes but the wire mesh is an addition, it’s not based on drawings and blueprints, is it?
It is based on a drawing made by the man who actually made these pillars. Michael Kula. In the camp workshop. In August 1941, he...
So this hole in the roof, or these holes in the roof, how many wire mesh columns were there? Four?
Four. IRVING laughs and throws down his documents.
Professor Pelt, we are wasting our time really, are we not? (MORE )
Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 69.

You yourself have stood on that roof and looked for those holes and not found them. Our experts have stood on that roof and not found them. IRVING points at the photo of the roof as it is today, ju an overgrown heap of rubble, then turns to GRAY.

My Lord, there are no holes in that roof. There never were any holes. Therefore they cannot have poured cyanide capsules through that roof. You will appreciate that if there had been those holes in the roof, which are the cardinal lynch-pin of the defence in this action, they would have been found by now. They have not found them and all the eyewitnesses on whom he relies are therefore exposed as the liars they are. DEBORAH has looked up to where REPORTERS in the gallery a scribbling frantically. VERA is shifting, trying to attra DEBORAH’S attention. She is scrawling a note to JULIUS: T WILL KILL US IN THE PRESS. IRVING looks to the clock, victorious.
My Lord, it is four minutes to four. Unless Mr Rampton wishes to say something to repair the damage...
My Lord, may I respond to this?
You may. But not until tomorrow. We adjourn for today. Ten-thirty. Thank you.
NETWORK REPORTERS are already facing the camera.

The Lipstadt trial took an extraordinary turn in the High Court today when evidence was presented which cast doubt on the idea that Auschwitz was ever used as an extermination camp. The historian David Irving -  96 Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 70. DEBORAH, JULIUS, HEATHER, LAURA and LIBSON are pouring ou the court in some disarray. DEBORAH is furious.
Just walk away. Say nothing.
Why did Rampton drop it? Why did he let it go?
Deborah, there are journalists. Keep walking and look straight ahead. They walk past ANOTHER REPORTER doing a piece to camera.
Mr Irving was effectively arguing ‘No holes, no holocaust...’ DEBORAH is stony-faced. RAMPTON has appeared beside them.
Richard, if you could give us some time...
I don’t have long.
It’s all right, we won’t take long. We have an unhappy client. RAMPTON notices as VERA steps into DEBORAH’S path.
Deborah, this is disastrous. This is what I told you. I told you! Why didn’t you listen? The group sweeps on, silent.
The group comes up the stairs in moody silence. They swee into JULIUS’s office. JULIUS throws down his gown.
All right, let’s look at this calmly. There’s no need to panic.
Irving pulled a rabbit out of the hat. He thinks it’s clever. It’s not clever. (MORE )
Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 71.
You produce some supposedly devastating piece of evidence at five minutes to four. JULIUS is now reaching for documents and photographs.
Here we are, look. It’s amateur. JULIUS is holding out photographs. He and DEBORAH talk ov each other. RAMPTON has sat down in a big armchair.
That doesn’t mean it isn’t effective.
Robert Jan will deal with it tomorrow. Look, look at these.
I’ve looked at them, I know them.
Here we are look, perfectly clear, the Olere drawings, the USAF aerial photos, the Little Train photo...

I know these photos, I’ve There they are. The holes, in seen them a thousand times, I all the photos in exactly t don’t need to look, that’s same place, same pattern, not the point I’m making... that’s what Robert Jan’s going to say, Robert Jan will Say...
Yes, and we know what Irving is going to say. He’s going to say they’re not holes, they’re shadows. They're glitches on the negative. Or they’re forgeries. Or they're paint-cans on the roof.
And we'll prove otherwise.
How do you prove that? It’s too late. It’s already out there! It’s in the press.
So?
Irving’s got what he came for. He wanted headlines. (MORE )
Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 72.

Well he’s got ‘em. ‘No holes, no holocaust!’ It’s 0.J. all over again! ‘If the glove doesn’t fit, you must acquit.’ That’s what he wanted. He wanted a catchy phrase. And now he’s got it. It’s like a virus -
Do you want tea?
No I don’t want tea. You know Just asking. what he’s doing...

He’s making it respectable to say there are two points of view. People hear the news, they think: ‘Oh I see, some people believe there were gas chambers at Auschwitz, and hey, this is interesting - some people don't.’ JULIUS looks to RAMPTON, but he is staring ahead, uninvol LAURA is giving them all tea. NIK and THOMAS are coming i pick up the photos and get them duplicated.
Deborah, you know why Irving chose Auschwitz-Birkenau in the first place?
Why he chose Auschwitz? Because everyone’s heard of it.
No.
Because of its emotional impact.
No.
Well?
Because it was not built as an extermination camp, it was built as a labour camp. Then it was modified.
I know that.  Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 73.

Yes, but that’s why he’s going after it. It’s a battering ram into a much bigger subject. Auschwitz is at the centre of Holocaust belief, that’s why it’s also at the centre of Holocaust denial. If you think of it logically, it makes no sense at all, what he said. Think what he’s saying... “No holes, no Holocaust!” He seizes one tiny fact, and because some detail can’t still be physically proved, he says “Oh well then, that means everything’s thrown into doubt. No- one in the camp was ever murdered. They all died of typhus! It wasn’t the Nazis who killed them, it was disease!” DEBORAH is shaking her head, not satisfied.
I know, I know he does that...
For goodness’ sake, it’s the same with the Hitler trick, offering a thousand dollars...
Exactly the same.

Tell me about it, I’m the one he did it to. “Oh well if you can’t find a piece of paper where Hitler says ‘Please murder the Jews’, then that proves Hitler never wanted them to die in the first place. Hitler was the Jews’ best friend.” He said that! He actually said it! JULIUS, LIBSON and DEBORAH are absorbed in their argument but RAMPTON has sat listening quietly throughout.
I have to go.
No, hold on...
What?  97 98 Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 74.
I want to say something and for once I want everyone to listen. I’m the fucking defendant! Frustrated and angry, DEBORAH has lost it completely, but RAMPTON is staring at her, thoughtful.

Even I know what the rule is. The client instructs. That’s the rule. Well the client’s instructing. The survivors go on the stand. And I go on the stand as well. She waits for the impact of her statement. But RAMPTON ju gets up and starts to leave.
Gentlemen.
What’s happening? Where are you going? Why’s he leaving? Richard, wait.
DEBORAH follows but RAMPTON is already disappearing down stairs, with a broad grin and an ironic wave of the hand. JULIUS follows DEBORAH out.

Because he has to prepare! That’s why he’s leaving. He doesn’t just turn up in court. He devotes his whole day, every minute of his day, rigorously, to this case and nothing but! And that’s the point! JULIUS has now lost it as well. DEBORAH is already shakin her head. But JULIUS is heading into a conference room.
JULIUS comes in, and starts looking through videos as the argue.
What you’re ignoring, what you refuse to deal with: we know what happened at Auschwitz because there are people who actually saw it...
Oh Deborah...  99 Full Blue Script // December 4th 2015 75.
Yes. With their own eyes. They’re called survivors.

Yes. And put survivors on the stand and Irving will humiliate them. Remember the Zundel trial. Remember the Exodus trial. The survivors got torn apart. Because survivors don’t remember. Not every detail. They get something wrong - they say a door was on the left, when actually it was on the right - and wham! Irving’s in. “You see! They’re liars, you can’t trust anything they say...”
